snippet: The world is much changed since 1962, but one thing has remained constant: The United States’ economic embargo on Cuba, a near-total trade ban that turned 50 on Tuesday.
abstract: Trade embargo on Cuba passes its 50th anniversary largely intact, despite bipartisan consensus that it has failed its core mission of toppling the regime of Fidel Castro; critics contend that the embargo hurts ordinary Cubans instead of the government, and a vast majority of nations back an annual resolution condemning it.
lead_paragraph: The world is much changed since 1962, but one thing has remained constant: The United States’ economic embargo on Cuba, a near-total trade ban that turned 50 on Tuesday.

headline.seo: American Embargo on Cuba Has 50th Anniversary
headline.main: 50 Years After Kennedy’s Ban, Embargo on Cuba Remains
headline.print_headline: 50 Years After Kennedy’s Ban, Embargo on Cuba Remains
